label: section_header
text: Tax assessment

label: text
text: We calculated your taxes using the amounts below. The following summary is based on the information we have or you gave us.

label: text
text: We may review your return later to verify income you reported or deductions or credits you claimed. For more information, go to canada.ca/taxes-reviews . Keep all your slips, receipts, and other supporting documents in case we ask to see them.

label: text
text: Note, DR (debit) is the amount you owe us and CR (credit) is the amount we owe you.

label: section_header
text: Summary

label: section_header
text: Explanation of changes and other important information

label: text
text: We calculated your RRSP deduction limit for 2024 based on 18% of your earned income for 2023, up to a maximum of $31,560. Refer to your RRSP deduction limit statement.

label: text
text: Your net capital loss for 2023 is $1,398. You can use this amount to reduce any taxable capital gains that you report in other years. For more information, see Guide T4037, Capital Gains.

label: section_header
text: Notice details

label: page_header
text: Page

label: text
text: GOUTHAM SABAPATHY 1402 SILVER MAPLE COURT BRAMPTON ON  L6T 4N5

label: text
text: As of the date of this notice, you have unused net capital losses from other years of $1,398. This amount includes any unused net capital losses created from this assessment. You can use your unused net capital losses to reduce taxable capital gains that you report this year. If you apply this amount to another year, y may have to recalculate your unused balance. This is because of the different capital gains rates for those years. For more information, see Guide T4037, Capital Gains.

label: text
text: Your Canada training credit limit for next year is $1,000.00. This credit will expire at the end of the year turn 65 or the year of death.

label: text
text: We got your application for the 2024 Ontario energy and property tax credit. We will let you know if you qualify for this credit.

label: text
text: If you have any questions about your assessment, please call our Individual Tax and Enquiries line at 1-800-959-8281. For individuals living in the territories (area code 867), call 1-866-426-1527.

label: section_header
text: Notice details

label: page_header
text: Page 4

label: section_header
text: RRSP deduction limitand available contribution roomstatement

label: text
text: References to RRSP contributions also include contributions to your pooled registered pension plan (PRPP) and to your and your spouse's or common-law partner's specified pension plan (SPP). For more information, go to canada.ca/rrsp or see Guide T4040, RRSPs and Other Registered Plans for Retirement.

label: section_header
text: Your unused RRSP deduction room at the end of 2023

label: section_header
text: Your additional RRSP deduction limit earned in 2023

label: section_header
text: Your 2024  RRSP deduction limit

label: text
text: Note: If your available RRSP contribution room is a negative amount (shown in brackets), you have no contribution room for 2024. You may have over contributed to your RRSP and have to pay a 1% monthly tax on any excess contributions. If you have, you must file a T1-OVP, Individual Tax Return for RRSP, PRPP and SPP Excess Contributions, and pay the taxes owing.

label: section_header
text: Notice details

label: page_header
text: Page

label: text
text: GOUTHAM SABAPATHY 1402 SILVER MAPLE COURT BRAMPTON ON  L6T 4N5

label: section_header
text: Home Buyers' Plan (HBP) statement

label: text
text: This statement confirms the minimum amount you have to repay to your RRSP, PRPP or SPP because you participated in the HBP. Repayments do not affect your RRSP deduction limit.

label: section_header
text: Notice details

label: page_header
text: Page 6

label: section_header
text: More information

label: text
text: If you need more information about your income tax and benefit return, go to canada.ca/taxes , go to My Account at canada.ca/my-cra-account , or call 1-800-959-8281 .For individuals living in the territories (area code 867), call 1-866-426-1527 .

label: section_header
text: If you move

label: text
text: Let us know your new address as soon as possible. For more information, go to canada.ca/cra-change-address .

label: section_header
text: If you have new information and want to change your return:

label: list_item
text: go to canada.ca/change-tax-return for faster service; or - write to your tax centre, and include your social insurance number and any documents supporting th e change. To find your tax centre, go to canada.ca/cra-offices .

label: section_header
text: If you want to register a formal dispute:

label: list_item
text: go to canada .ca/cra-complaints-disputes ; you have 90 days from the date of this notice to register your dispute.

label: section_header
text: Help for persons with hearing, speech, or visual impairments

label: text
text: You can get this notice in braille, large print, electronic text, or audio format. For more informat ion, go to canada.ca/cra-multiple-formats .

label: text
text: If you use a teletypewriter, you can get tax information by calling 1-800-665-0354 .
